titleStmt.title: A Translation of the Undertext of Luke in Codex Zacynthius
Gregory-Aland 040
The New Testament
The Gospel according to Luke
Luke
titleStmt.funder: The Arts and Humanities Research Council

sponsor.name: The Institute for Textual Scholarship and Electronic Editing

publisher.name: The Institute for Textual Scholarship and Electronic Editing
University of Birmingham

availability.p: Licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0): available for re-use provided attribution is made to the original creators (the project and named participants) and an indication is given of any changes made. See further .

surrogates.bibl: Colour images made for the Codex Zacynthius project

listBibl.bibl: S.P. Tregelles, Codex Zacynthius, London: Bagster and Sons, 1861 (full transcription)
J. Harold Greenlee, “A Corrected Collation of Codex Zacynthius (Cod. Ξ)” JBL 76.3 (1957) 237–41 (list of corrections to Tregelles)
H.A.G. Houghton, Panagiotis Manafis, A.C. Myshrall, The Palimpsest Catena of Codex Zacynthius: Text and Translation. Texts and Studies 3.22, Piscataway NJ: Gorgias, 2020.

projectDesc.p: This translation was made of the transcription of the undertext of Luke created by the Codex Zacynthius Project in 2018 from multispectral digital images.

editorialDecl.p: This file covers all surviving pages of the undertext. The file includes foliation, lineation and punctuation. Corrections are rendered when this is possible in English. The base text used for the translation was the NRSV, which was adjusted to match the readings of the manuscript by Robert Ferro and reviewed by Hugh Houghton.
The XML specifications used are version 1.5 of the IGNTP Guidelines available at

revisionDesc.change: Review of translation and checking of all titloi by Hugh Houghton prior to publication of revised edition (version 1.1).
The initial translation completed by Robert Ferro on 24th July 2019 was revised and amended by Hugh Houghton.
